results.content: The course is too brief and the explanation is not clear. It will just show you how to create a simple to do list web application, but even if you can follow the steps to do it, you ended up not sure why you do it that way. There is no explanation on how to construct your app in MVC, so you might be programming meteor, and not in the correct manner. You can get more details from free articles, instead of this mere 30 minutes course, which does not justify the USD $14.

results.content:
Thanks for this fantastic introduction to Meteor I have really enjoyed building my first realtime web app, much simpler than Node JS and the course gave me all the tools I need to continue on!

Thanks again.
results.content_html:

results.content: Hard to believe, but in less than an hour the instructors guide you through the steps needed to build a simple app.  Not only that, but they make sure you understand what you are doing.  When I was done, I had no trouble adding my own extra features.
results.content_html: Hard to believe, but in less than an hour the instructors guide you through the steps needed to build a simple app. Not only that, but they make sure you understand what you are doing. When I was done, I had no trouble adding my own extra features.

results.content: I took this course and finally finished a Udemy course!! It was fantastic. The pace was good and the level of detail was perfect. The course gave insight into Meteor, Handlebars, and Bootstrap all integrated together which is what you need to know to create anything. It's hard to learn technology if it's just listing all the features one by one without an integrated project. You end up knowing many little things without being able to put together a real project. This course put together a nice project showing how all the pieces fit together. It doesn't go into too much depth on Handlebars etc. but enough depth that the student can learn more about Handlebars on their own or through a more detailed course. Thanks for a wonderful course!! I was very impressed with the real-time updates to multiple browsers without hitting the refresh browser button!!

results.content: If you've done the intro tutorial on the Meteor site, this doesn't add much beyond a little extra context. The actual lectures are well done and informative, and the added context around packages is useful for folks just starting to look at Meteor. Not sure it's worth $29, though.
